docs.title: SuperBank
docs.text:
Toolkit for building and shipping digital art resources (brushes, palettes, packs).

  • Export brushes/palettes with sidecar metadata
  • Pack into a distributable ZIP (MANIFEST.json inside)
  • Validate packs and individual files
  • Automate via CLI tools and CI releases

docs.text: This page describes how a SuperBank pack is structured on disk and what each file is for.

docs.title: Plugin Specification
docs.text:
SuperBank plugins are plain Python modules in plugins/ with this minimal API:

PLUGIN_INFO = {
  "name": "Human-readable name",
  "description": "Short sentence about what it does",
  "category": "Tools|Brushes|Palettes|Maintenance|Export|Other",
  "icon": "icons/box.svg"  # path under ui/icons (optional)
}

def run(parent=None):
    """Entry point called by the host.
    `parent` is a QWidget/QDialog parent you can use for UI.
    """
    ...

docs.title: Pack Profiles
docs.text: Pack Profiles let you batch-build packs from a JSON file — either from the GUI or CLI.

docs.title: Export
docs.text:
• Brush Builder pick PNG tip exports .gbr + .meta.json
  • Palette Wizard → pick image → exports .gpl + .meta.json

docs.title: Pack & Validate
docs.text:
• Tools Pack Builder (GUI)
  • Or CLI: python tools\pack_builder.py --types all python tools\validate_pack.py packs

docs.title: Maintenance
docs.text:
• Tools Maintenance Tools Backfill sidecars / Make previews
  • Tools Update Checker open latest release page

docs.title: Sidecar Schema (v1.0)
docs.text:
Sidecars live next to exported assets as *.meta.json. They carry author, license, version and per-asset details SuperBank uses when:

  • building packs
  • generating release notes
  • validating resources

Naming Sidecar filename: <original-filename>.<ext>.meta.json Example: sb_dry-edge_v1.0.0_512px.gbr.meta.json

docs.title: Common fields (all types)
docs.text:
